intro: Barleriola, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plant has compact, succulent leaves that help it retain water in its harsh environment. Its flowers are small and typically white or pale blue, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Barleriola is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils, showcasing its adaptation to extreme conditions.
